newsitem.title: USA: Trump sees Q3 earnings above expectations.
newsitem.headline: Trump sees Q3 earnings above expectations.

text.p: Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts Inc Chairman Donald Trump said the company expects to earn $0.95 a share in its third quarter ended September 30, well ahead of forecasts.
"We expect over $0.95 a share, which is higher than predicted by the Street," Trump told investors at the Salomon Brothers Gaming and Lodging Conference here.
Analysts expect the company to earn $0.78 a share in the third quarter, according to First Call.
Trump also said the company's new riverboat in Buffington Harbor, Indiana is expected to generate $65 million in cash flow 1997, its first full year of operation.

Trump's Chief Executive Officer Nicholas Ribis said the company expects an "announcement" regarding Trump's plans in the United Kingdom on Thursday, but he declined to offer any details about the announcement.

In Atlantic City, Trump's Taj Mahal casino reported the strongest month for revenues in its history with nearly $58 million flowing into the hotel's coffers in September. That tops a record of $50 million set in August last year.

Trump also plans to change the name of its newly acquired Trump Castle hotel to Trump Marina. Plans call for Trump to dock its 432-foot yacht nearby and build a glass-enclosed walkway to it. The yacht will add 35,000 square feet of casino space and is scheduled to open in the fourth quarter of 1997.
